job_description:
We are not working with recruitment agencies at this time

Owl.co is a software company that enables insurers to fight illegitimate claims at scale, while removing human bias from the process. Our clients are the top insurance companies across North America and are getting incredible results through our AI powered evidence-based platform. We are on a mission to bring state of the art ML and NLP methods to transform this traditionally manual activity into an equitable process. We are well-funded and have engineering offices in New York City, Toronto, and Vancouver.

About The Role

We are looking for ambitious Senior/Staff level engineers with experience in ML systems to build the core intelligence behind our products. At Owl, you would lead the design, implementation, and production of some of the most impactful systems in the insurance industry.

What You’ll Be Doing

Collaborate directly with the CTO and the rest of the engineering team to build ML-powered systems and products
Use state of the art NLP/ML techniques to annotate unstructured data
Devise experiments to improve ML models
Work cross-functionally to solve challenging product problems
Lead technical discussions and help drive technical decisions within the team
Develop clear, well-documented, and maintainable code across the entire stack
Mentor junior engineers and contribute to growth of the engineering team

Ideal Experience

7+ years of Software Engineering with experience serving in a Staff level capacity
Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field
Experience with ML and NLP systems
Recent experience with operating high QPS systems in production
Substantial experience leading large products/systems from inception to production
Demonstrated analytical and data-driven approach to problem-solving
Experience in writing clear and concise planning and requirements documents

Benefits

$1,200 ($100 monthly) per year into a Wellness or Healthcare Spending Account
RRSP matching up to 4% of base salary
4 weeks of vacation, 10 public holidays, plus 5 personal days
Hybrid work model
Dog-friendly office
Weekly team lunches in the office
